guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for acenocoumarol and VKORC1

relatedGenes.name: vitamin K epoxide reductase complex subunit 1

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299301

text.html:
Monitoring by the ANTICOAGULATION CLINIC (National INR Monitoring Service):

  • recommend to use 50% of the standard initial dose

OTHERWISE:

  • recommend to use 50% of the standard initial dose
  • recommend more frequent monitoring of the INR

implications: An INR â‰¥ 6, resulting in an increased risk of bleeding, occurs in 8-12% of these patients during the first weeks of treatment with standard regulation by the Anticoagulation Clinic. The genetic variation increases the sensitivity to acenocoumarol.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299299

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications:
The genetic variation results in a reduction of the required dose, but with the current practice of initiating or reviewing treatment this results in little or no increased risk of
bleeding or excessive anticoagulation.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299300

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for acenocoumarol in patients with the VKORC1 rs9923231 CC genotype (-1639 GG genotype).

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of the -1639 GG genotype on acenocoumarol.
